attributes.action: encourage the Metropolitan Police to be fully disability aware by recognising Crohn's Disease,Irritable Bowel Syndrome,Colitis and Urinary Incontinence as disabilities when a person is held in custody and arrest-currently the Metropolitan Police do not cater for these disabilities as they are classed as hidden disability and there is "no call" to provide specific services in London Police stations
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A person detained under arrest should be catered for fully in a disability aware capital wide police force.
However this is appears to not be the case.The "hidden disability" of urinary and faecal incontinence caused by Colitis,Crohn's disease.IBS or through similar urinary or bowel disablement Currently this is not recognised as a disability by the Metroploitan Police in its day to day business according to their Freedon of Information Unit.
It is vital that this should be recognised by the Metropolitan Police
to reflect a fully inclusive disability policy.The first step towards this would be to ensure incontuinence pads are provided as standard as a wheelchair would be.This is currently not the case.
